Posts.Content: Methusala wrote: Today was my one week follow up from my mastectomy (right side) with reconstruction started (that stretcher thingy) and a reduction on the left side. When I went to the third floor at Roswell, to the Nurse Practitioner, she took my dressings off, etc. and told me that once you have radiation, you can NOT go back in for an expander because the skin will be too tight and will NOT stretch. I do have my expander it (and dam*) it HURTS... but I'm glad I had it done now, because the way she talked, you can NOT have an expander put in AFTER radiation. is this true?? does radiation hurt your skin THAT much? also, the sentinel node was positive, so they took out ALL my lymph nodes.. they said there were 38 of them... and ALL 38 tested NEGATIVE!!!! yahooooooooooo!!!!! but my arm hurts so much were they cut under there It hurts no matter how much pain meds I take! NOTHING helps the painful numbness or muscle spasms!! OUCH! BRCA 1 + and the BIG 3, triple negative.. Life is short. Pray hard with your kids. Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2007 09:32AM Methusala wrote: talking of eyebrows, I have to thank G-d for small favours, I never lost my eyebrows or eyelashes.  They got thin, but actually look better thin, I've never been one to pluck those things.. ouch.  But seriously, I really am greatful for that one small dignity, ya know?  Doesn't our society just judge us by our boobs and hair?  Women judge each other, men judge women, all the advertising about hair and boobs.  And breast cancer takes it all away.  One thing I have learned is to focus more on myself as a person, the vanity has been stripped away, and I really hope it never comes back. Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2007 09:16PM Methusala wrote: hi- I have no idea what drug they are trying.. they told me.. but..  It's going to take app. 2.5 hours to infuse, I know that, and I go for 4 sessions, one every three weeks.  I start this Saturday.  We'll see how it goes. My son stopped saying his hair is falling out, but he's so clingy.  He, too, has ocd, but at 5, there is no way I can medicate the little guy.  It's really improved since he started pre-k, with OT and behaviour modification.  He really is the light of my life. The dr. gave me some strong pain pills to fight off the neulasta pain, plus a script for lomotil for diarrhea.  No more emend or steroids either.   Like Spongebob says: "i'm ready, i'm ready, i'm ready" oh, found out today I am: neg, neg, neg!! (for hormone thingys) I am grade 2, and stage 2b.  I finally saw my path. report from August.

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2007 10:22PM Methusala wrote: hi everyone. I finally have the time and ENERGY to come back here.  First, I have to say THANK THE LORD for chemoangels.  I have the two BEST in the world. next, I AM DONE with chemo!! sadly, my fingernails are excruciatingly painful and falling off, Roswell said 2-3 months for new nails  UGH... and my vision went flop yesterday.  Scared me so bad.  The said a few days , a week, rarely a month or two, and it would be back to normal.  It really scared me so bad, all of the sudden I couldn't see.  Everything was blurry.  MY mother started crying.  (good grief...) but today it honestly seems a bit better.  I had my rad appt. today and it went well.  I really do NOT want permanent tats , but whatever I guess, ya know.. in the long scheme of things, I care less and less about this stuff.  Then we did a little bit of Christmas shopping, which cheered me up.  One lady looked at me like I was a leper..  but most people were very kind to me.  I didn't feel like I was being stared at for a change.  Although I look like hell, I'm down to 140, lost over 30 pounds since sept. 18.  my pupils are fixed and dilated, and my nails are purple, I have sores on my face... LOL I guess I do look like a leper, I guess I'd stare at me too now that I think about it...   well, I'm kind of rambling, but I haven't been back here in weeks, and trying to read all the posts.   My lap top was also in the shop for 3 weeks, I got it back and it's worse than when I sent it in, so now it's gone back.   Anyway.. ta ta for now, I tired myself out writing all this!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in September?? where are you ladies Methusala StillKicking

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2008 12:00PM Methusala wrote: I too get sick and tired of being stared at. That's the ONE thing I've really complained about through all of this.  Seriously.  I find kids staring at me all the time, but I've found a big smile usually gets a big smile back.  Honestly, I can't stand other peoples kids (mine are perfect ya know) but seriously, if you smile at them, especially like 7 or 8 year old girls, you will get a big smile of relief back.   As for adults, screw them all.  In APplebee's last Friday an old man was staring at me and I stared right back, I kid you not ladies, after the THIRD time I stared this man down, he did NOT look back, he actually turned his back to me in his booth.  If the old fart is going down memory lane, then he needs to come up and introduce himself and tell me his story, I can handle that these days, but don't stare at me out of your own insecurities and ignorance.  I have enough crap to deal with in my every day life. One thing I love about Roswell, I can walk around bald, and almost NOONE looks at me.  I love it. (except the new people in the lobby, and I think I just give them a good scare. <eg>

Posts.Content: Methusala wrote: Hi everyone. Is this the place for new people just joining? I didn't see a separate thread... Hubby found a lump in my right breast about ten days ago, on a Tuesday. On Thurs. I went to my GP, and he sent me home with antibiotics and said it was a cyst, and told me not to worry about it. He'd see how it was in two weeks. By Sunday night I was a wreck, so Monday AM I called my nurse Midwife (no I'm not pregnant, I see her for my 'female' stuff). They got me right in Monday afternoon. She was really concerned, as SHE found another lump (my dr. missed it) and sent me up to Buffalo to a breast clinic. At the clinic I had 3 very painful Mammograms, one ultrasound, and an excruciating biopsy. The dr. there told me "It doesn't look good". She said, "we'll treat this aggressively" and "You will still need an MRI". They said the results from the biopsy would be in Fri., no later than Monday. As of Friday, they results were not back. So, I'm sitting here.. near hysterical again.. LOL it comes in waves, sometimes I'm fine, other times, I'm in a panic I can't get out of. I had a sister die of breast cancer when she was 38. I am 37!!! I had never had a mammogram before. WOW did it hurt when the smooshed the tumor on top. whenever I roll over or bend over, I about scream in pain. It took 3 lortabs to get the throbbing in my breast to stop tonight. IT HURTS! I have no indents, drainage, or anything like that. The top tumore is one inch around they told me, and it HURTS! yikes! anyway, that's my story. Long enough to bore everyone I'm sure. I'm here looking for support, and reading posts to see what's going on with others. I don't know anyone who has or had b. cancer. I never knew my sister that died. My father also died of cancer, as did his brother and everyone on that side of the family. Thanks folks for letting me rant. I do have some questions.. like "WHAT NEXT" and "How do I stay CALM"... and "can I kick my dr. that sent me home with antibiotics?? I am so angry at him I could scream!! How could he just blow this off?? How could he miss such a serious medical issue?" I HATE HIM right now for not taking this seriously. If I had listened to HIM, I'd still be in the dark, taking unnecessary drugs, and not even seeing him again until THIS Thursday! JERK!! I'm so glad I followed my heart and called my Nurse Midwife.. she's the greatest. so.. what now?? thanks everyone. I didn't realize how badly I needed to unload. oh.. what about my teenage daughter? I've told her everything... is there a support group for her? and my hubby is THE GREATEST. BRCA 1 + and the BIG 3, triple negative.. Life is short. Pray hard with your kids. Dx 6/2007, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 1/38 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Methusala wrote: what is the difference between a bone scan and a pet scan?? I had a bone scan today. I asked for a picture, and they gave me one. The guy told me that NO ONE had EVER asked for a picture before. LOL well I have mine, now of course I'm reading EVERY LITTLE THING into it. Posts.Content: Methusala wrote: Hi Ladies, I'm back... sort of!  I'm going to try a different drug, starting tomorrow.  I went to the dr. last Th and told him I QUIT ha ha.  He offered a different drug, and after MUCHO consideration, I've decided to give it a whirl.  He offered me narcotics... so I think it's a fair trade.. LOL LOL  really tho', the drugs are for the bone pain I had, he said less than 1% of women get as sick as I did on the Adrimyacin (sp?)..  Guess I'm pretty rare and special, eh?  I'm also bald.  it took the full 2 weeks, but my hair is gone, gone, gone.  It's very liberating.  I'm just sick and tired of the stares.  I really am.  Even with a hat on, I get stares.  People are ignorant.  oh well.  Back to Roswell tomorrow. by the way, I never watch tv much, but this AM, hubby had channel 4 on and they were selling PINK stuff for this week, and the lady told people to go visit breastcancer.org, on NATIONAL TV  cool!!  made be proud to be part of this community.  The only sad part is, they were excited that 25% of the proceeds were being donated, to breast cancer, I was not excited, how about 100%!!!???  BRCA 1 + and the BIG 3, triple negative.. Life is short. Pray hard with your kids. Dx 6/2007, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 1/38 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2007 05:07PM Methusala wrote: ^hi Margo.. I'm still regretting my expander. I hope that someday the pain will be gone and I'll feel better, but not having resconstruction would have saved me allot of pain and effort. I don't mean to sound so negative.. But I'm really sick and tired of taking pain pills. It's just not my style.. Now all you ladies who did so well, come here, so I can kick ya'll a good one!! seriously tho'.. I commend you women! I am normally a strong willed woman... but this surgery kicked my arse. It still hurts to hug my son.. he need a hug tonight , bumped his head, and I couldn't even snuggle with him.. DA*N this cancer stuff.

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2008 01:52PM Methusala wrote: you're not going to offend many of us with your bra comment...  that's the beauty of this place.. we're all in it together.  you have your own journey, if that's what is bothering you, say so.  Just because you had a lumpectomy and some of us has mastectomy, doesn't lessen your pain and trials.  You're problems are just as valid as ours. I haven't posted much on here, or my blog, but my life has been a whirlwind.  I haven't even thanked my chemo angels for all their kindness...  I can't wait til this nightmare is over and I have the time and mental status to be one!! Well ladies, it's Thursday morning...  and Th. are the most hectic for me.  So what do I do? sit here LOL LOL I have a 'tech' in my rad office that I do not like.  I think she senses I do NOT like her.  She rubs me the wrong way.  She's like all of 23?  5'2", cropped plantinum hair.. and just.. well.. just.. ye gads... if she says one more condescending remark to me, I'm going to have to slap her one with the stupid stick!  all the other girls are very quiet, look you in the eye, compassionate... this one tho'.. she thinks she's all that and a bag of chips, ya know??   *sigh*  is it just me??  tell me ladies, do I need to "man up" LOL and forget it?  Maybe I'm just directing my anger at her... I'm so darn tired of this cancer running my life.. telling me where I have to be and when, surgery, radiation, chemo, appointments...  drugs, co-pays...   I WANT MY LIFE BACK!!! and I want it back NOWWWWW!!! hm.. well. heh he heh... Did I mention I haven't taken my xanax today? LOL happy Thursday.

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2008 12:37AM Methusala wrote: Trying to catch up here.. I'm glad I'm not the only one with hair issues.. unreal.. my hair is growing straight up.  not kidding.  I have a mohawk.  One more indignity in my life yahoo.  My hair is coming in the same colour as my son's.  With a touch of grey. ah well.  I go to Roswell April 24th and hopefully will find out then when the expander can come out.  It's like sleeping on a BRICK.  Even after 9-10 months the darn thing still hurts like heck at night. On a crappy note, the Post Office is trying to sue my husband for the family leave he took for me last Fall during chemo.  Can you say amen sister.. he's worked for them for nearly 30 years, and this is the slap in the face he gets.  They approved it last Fall, he has the letter to prove it, but they say he should have known better, and has to pay back 12K of it.  OMG.  Life's a beach around here.  Then our income tax refund was $1,200 LESS than we thought, cause I defaulted on a student loan.  I just can't win. Anway.. on a happy note, I have a little bit of hair... yee ha...  soon I will throw my hat away.
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2008 11:59PM Methusala wrote: hey, they did NOT put me out at all to take the port out.  They just stuck novacaine in, (I yelled, it hurt, then I didn't feel a thing) not in that order lol, actually, I did feel the second injection...  No tylenol or anything at all.. that was last Th, today is Monday PM and it is still so tender... argh! as for lung damage, I've had TWO rad consults and both drs. said the exact same thing, minor, like 1% of lung would be damaged, and that it was ok, because 98-99 would be functioning just fine ha ha. I would really wonder if I had a dr. tell me there would be no lung damage, etc. not trying to freak anyone out here, but it just seems to me that ANY amount of radiation is harmful to some extent.  You just have to weigh your pros and cons. Both drs. also agree absolutely no deodorant except the second dr. gave me free sample of deodarant ( A BIG SIZED one too, that will last!) and they gave me a full bag of aquaphor, said to use it all over, my hands were/are really dry and the nurse said almost all the chemo patients they see have 'chemo skin' and that this aquaphor would work anywhere.  My hands are terribly dry, I just thought it was old man winter etc. They did tell me no perfumes, but that was because they get some really sick people in there and smells can really bother them more than usual. (Fine with me, my own dr.'s secretary had a candle burning IN THE OFFICE! that made me nauseated!!) no bubble baths, etc. as it could really irritate the skin, unscented ivory soap was all they approved of during radiation. well, I've typed enough.  I'm escaping reality right now.  My 16 yo dd was majorlly rude to a friend of mine today so I turned her internet off, and she went behind me and turned it back on. *sigh*  She's lucky ALL I did was yell at her ( I never yell at my kids... trust me I'm a calm person) and for the first time all I wanted to do was smack that rude mouth of hers. too many appointments, too many pills, too much pain, hot flashes, and I feel like my period wants to rush forth and greet me with a big hello, but since I'm in forced menopause, it's going to just be crampy forever... and then that mouth.. I was embarrassed for both of us!  hm.. I hear voices... yes... voices... they are calling me... yes....I'm sure now, the fridge is yelling to me to let the Zinfandel out...  hm.. guess I better go see what's going on... I think that zinfandel NEEDS me right now...
